item.title: Has item and delete item
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:3, topic:534215”]Just a slight conventional point, it should still be called hasItem, because that’s what it’s doing. You can have multiple methods with the same name, just different parameters - take advantage of this![/quote]fair point

either way good snippet strucker

item.title: Has item and delete item
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Just a slight conventional point, it should still be called hasItem, because that’s what it’s doing. You can have multiple methods with the same name, just different parameters - take advantage of this!

item.title: Has item and delete item
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

for some reason in delta the has item and delete item, it would only check for one, or only delete for one.
I made this methods and placed them in misc, for me. i guess i would share.

[code]public static boolean hasItemAmount(Player player, int item, int amount) {
for (int i = 0; i < amount; i++) {
if(player.playerHasItem(item)) {
player.sM(“Has item “+i+””);
}
if( i == amount && player.playerHasItem(item)) {
return true;
}
}
return false;
}

public static void deleteItems(Player player, int item, int amount) {
	for (int i = 0; i < amount; i++) {
		player.deleteItem(item, 1);
	}
}

[/code]

Read full topic
